title: What happened to Bex in EastEnders – a recap of her suicide storyline
text:
Bex has been through quite the ordeal… (Picture: BBC/Kieron McCarron)

Bex Fowler (Jasmine Armfield) has been having a very difficult time on EastEnders in the run-up to when she was supposed to leave Walford for university.

When the day of her surprise leaving party arrived, Bex reached her breaking point.

Here’s what you need to know about what happened to her…

What happened to Bex in EastEnders?

Bex hasn’t exactly had the easiest year, what with her dependency on ADHD meds back in spring.

On top of that, she’s recently been finding it hard to cope with the pressure of her impending move to Oxford for university.

Bex put on a happy face for her surprise going away party, but Lisa (Lucy Benjamin) saw through it and could tell something was up.

She encouraged Bex to tell her mum how she feels and reminded her that it’s her life she’s leading, so she didn’t have to go if she didn’t want to.

Bex didn’t seem to want to hear it however, brushing Lisa off and leaving the pub after a quick speech.

When she was far from the maddening crowd at The Vic, Bex tried to take her own life.

Thankfully she survived, but Sonia (Natalie Cassidy) will eventually feel like she’s to blame for her daughter’s actions.

EastEnders has been working on the storyline with Samaritans, and Jon Sen, Executive Producer, told Metro.co.uk: ‘We wanted to take Bex on a journey which accurately reflected the crises facing many young people today – many of whom, like Bex, struggle under the mounting pressures placed on teenagers today.

‘Having worked closely with Samaritans, our wish is that by telling this story we can encourage others in Bex’s position to realise there’s always help and there’s always hope and we hope that others will be encouraged to start a conversation if they are worried about someone they know.’

EastEnders is on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday nights on BBC One.
